intro: Connarus jaramilloi, commonly known as the Jaramillo's connarus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Connarus jaramilloi is considered critically endangered.
